solution.text: At time t=0, the temperature of water is 28 degree celsius as represented by point A in the graph that lies on the y-axis

content.text:
A=(0,28), B=(1,42), C=(2,51), D=(3,71), E=(4,71), F=(8,100)
What was the initial temperature of water?

solution.text:
Point A=(0,28), Point B=(1,42)
Rise in temperature in the first minute = 42-28
=14

content.text: By how many degrees did the temperature rise in the first minute?

solution.text:
Point C=(2,51), Point D=(4,71)
Rise in temperature in the third minute = 71-51
=20

content.text: By how many degrees did the temperature rise in the third minute?

solution.text:
The line segment joining point D and E is a horizontal line and the co-ordinates of point D and E are (3,71) and (4,71) respectively.
This shows the temperature was constant in the fourth minute at 71 degrees celsius

content.text: Was the temperature constant for any duration? If yes, what was the constant temperature?

solution.text:
Point F=(8,100)
This shows the water attained its boiling point after 8 minutes

content.text: After how many minutes did the water attain its boiling point?

solution.text:
Observe carefully, the lines of the two graphs coincide at point E.
Therefore, the predicted score was same as the actual score in the 5th match.

We know, the predicted and actual scores were the same in the 5th match.
Draw a perpendicular to the y-axis from point E.
This value reflects the score in that match which is 237 runs

content.text: Specify the score in the match where the actual score and predicted score were the same.

solution.text:
Notice that on the graph of predicted scores, point D1 is the highest.
Draw a perpendicular to the y-axis from point D1.
That value reflects the highest predicted score in the series which is 391 runs

content.text: What was the highest predicted score during the series?

solution.text:
Notice that on the graph of actual scores, point C2 is the lowest.
Draw a perpendicular to the y-axis from point C2.
That value reflects the highest predicted score in the series which is 123 runs

content.text: What was the lowest actual score during the series?

solution.text:
Notice that point F1(predicted score in match 6) and point F2(actual score in match 6) are furthest from each other as compared to any other set of point
Therefore, the difference between the actual and predicted scores is the most in match 6

content.text: In which match did the actual score differ the most from the predicted score?

solution.text:
We know that the difference between the actual and predicted scores is the most in match 6
Point F1=(6,332), Point F2=(6,186)
Difference in scores=332-186
146

content.text: What was the greatest difference in the predicted and actual scores in a single match?

Therefore, the movie earned 73 crores in its first week

solution.text:
Point c=(3,94)
Therefore, the movie earned 94 crores in its third week

content.text: What were the earnings in week 3?

solution.text:

Therefore, the movie earned 38 crores in its fifth week

content.text: What were the earnings in week 5?

solution.text:
Point b=(2,61), Point d=(4,47)
Therefore, the movie earned 61 crores and 47 crores in the second and fourth weeks respectively
Difference in earnings = 61-47
=14 crores

content.text: Compute the difference between the earnings of week 2 and week 4?

solution.text:
Point c=(3,94), Point d=(4,47)
Therefore, the movie earned 94 crores and 47 crores in the third and fourth weeks respectively
Difference in earnings = 94-47
=47 crores
Hence, the greatest difference in earnings as compared to its previous week was in week 4.

content.text: In which week was there the greatest difference in earnings as compared to its previous week?
